Anonymous Sat 23 Sep 2017 03:53:18 No.11687089 Report
Quoted By: >>11687155 >>11687758 >>11689422 >>11689945
>>11679972
Hobo here for the late writefag tip of the thread

Never delete what you've written. Proofread and correct mistakes? Yes. Delete the file/all the text? Fuck no.
If you ever are just not feeling what you're currently putting down, just save the file, open up a new document, and start something fresh. Maybe you'll feel the buzz of inspiration again and come back to it. Maybe that idea can serve as a jump off point for something better down the line. But don't you dare delete that shit.

Even big time, best seller writing authors have tomes upon tomes of unfinished manuscripts. Mountains of notebooks filled with manically written ideas that struck them so hard it woke them up from sleep, so they reached for the nearest piece of paper and writing utensil and jotted it down before their wakeful state robbed them of inspiration. Zipped up bags filled with scribbled on diner napkins, hoping to save them from their disposable by design nature long enough to get back to the notion that was idly scribbled onto them. Keep what you have, even if you have to stick it into a password locked folder titled "Refined Autism."

tl;dr never get rid of your written work. Just put it away for another time.

>>11691938
I don't use feedback when I write. Not often, at least. I more revel in the fact that I can take my thoughts from inside of my head and show them to others. The fact that people do or don't like me isn't why I'm here. This place is a community. We are all brothers. Maybe some weird sister hiding and praying to not be found, but brothers for the most part. And I enjoyed your lynx greentext. It was cute.

If you feel that you need to be better, then push yourself to be better and try to push yourself to write more when you do write. Originally, chickenman was going to be a short little 8 chapter affair darting around and doing fuck all but being a thin pretext for porn. Then I figured I could write a real story. Make some characters. Have them interact. Now it's going to be 22 chapters. I just figured the few people that like my writing would enjoy it to be a longer story. Why not really brainstorm for an idea, then set up some basic chapters in your head? Bridge the gaps between those chapters with plot points, then connect them to ideas and build a story around that. Or hell, write a bunch of short greens. Lord knows I like doing that now for some reason.

I mean, really, all I can do is ask you to stay here. To keep it up. You aren't shit, even if you think you are. You've got the skill to make some solid rapid stories, and I'm really excited for every single green that's in this thread, yours included. Why? We're a community. I want us all to get along and prosper. There aren't tiers of writes on that OP, armain. Some may be better at one thing than another, but not a single one of us is so bad we should just stop writing. I can't make you write. I can't make you hang out. I can't make this place into a proper fucking band of brothers, but I'll be damned if I'm not going to ask for it. So if you want to, knowing I can't stop you, pull up a chair. Let's write some weird stories about furries loving anons. Let's all be a family.
